intro: Aethionema schelkovnikowii, commonly known as the Caucasian rock cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Caucasus region. It typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, arid environments. The plant features small, clustered leaves and produces yellow flowers in early summer. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
